job_title: PRC in Orlando, FL
pros: Plenty of overtime if you're willing to work at other centers
cons:
No holiday pay
No weekend pay
No shift differential 
No incentive pay
Very stressful environment 
Little support from management 
You have to stay in the role 6 months before transferring 
12hr shifts sitting
Dirt work spaces
Almost no benefit 
If you're part time don't get insurance, you'll be working to only pay for it because It's so expensive. 
This job is very stressful and you do a lot of work and the pay doesn't begin to meet the work load and stress level.

job_title: Nursing Assistant in Saint Cloud, MN
pros: Great place to gain experience- you learn A TON!! A lot of the staff really does become your second family. There IS some administrative junk, as you will see below. But all in all, I've only become a better NA for working here, and in the future I will be a better nurse because of it.
cons: Favoritism and unequal standards for employees based upon race. Most positions are underpaid for the amount of work expected. No hazard pay or significant bonuses with covid surges. Staffing cuts due to covid resulting in being dangerously short staffed- especially on overnight shifts.

job_title: Information Systems in Saint Cloud, MN
pros: The coworkers are wonderful people. Overall, the working atmosphere is great. There is great job security in the department I work in, even in the midst of a pandemic. There is a variety of work, and opportunities for some advancement.
cons:
This company focuses a lot on the bottom line. They refuse to pay competitively with local
They do have yearly raises, but they are a small percent. The costs of benefits goes up yearly, retirement benefits are constantly reduced. The company has become a monopoly in the area, and takes advantage of it. 
There are senior leadership who are not transparent - for example, sending out an e-mail about the reduced retirement contributions, and trying to word it as though it is a benefit to employees.

job_title: Operating Room Assistant in Saint Cloud, MN
pros: Some of my co-workers were really nice people.
cons: Management is horrible! They follow a chain of command system if you have problems but all the supervisors and those above them are all friends so no help there. The supervisor never showed her face and when she did it was because she had a problem to complain about. She was completely fake and rude she would ask a question and walk away before you had a chance to answer or start a conversation with someone else. The turn over rate was horrible (40 people quit in my 3 years of working there) and they all went to HR to complain about the management. The lead was big on gossip and would tell everyone's business even if it was confidential. There is a lot of favoritism and divide between the morning team and the PM team. The place was drama central. And it's hard to change departments because the supervisor won't let you. There is way too much to do for the pay they offer. Because people quit the team was always short staff and had to do more. The nurses and doctors were super mean and would try to blame everything on you even things that were suppose to be their job. All in all you hard and get treated like nothing.

job_title: Programmer/Analyst in Saint Cloud, MN
pros: Great benefits!  The people are very nice and the atmosphere is completely void of all of those downtown snobs you run into in the cities.
cons:
The only con - but a big one - is that there's no advancement for me here.  I recently approached my manager asking for some insight into my career advancement within the company.  I was told that my position - in it's current department - typically doesn't advance to the next level.  Ok, I then asked if I could be considered for another department in the company.  The answer I got back was a bit cryptic, but I believe I was being told that I'm too vital where I'm currently at.

In short, it's a classic dead-end job.  For me anyways.  Your mileage may vary.

review_title: Does not follow own open door policy, uses unethical means in addressing employee concerns.
job_title: Houskeeper in Long Prairie, MN
pros: Hard working employees on the ground floor.
cons: CentraCare protects management that use unethical conduct towards people they have power over.  Shortly after I brought up concerns about implications to management decisions in regards to standards of cleaning, knowingly false claims about me were used in written termination documentation and I was escorted off of the grounds. I proved to unemployment that the claim was knowingly false which I had to do in order to receive unemployment. I received my unemployment. I then contacted CentraCare employee relations and provided them with the same documentation that I had sent to unemployment and requested that my personnel be changed to reflect the truth about my termination. The response was that they would change it if I would agree via contract to certain terms. I find the terms unreasonable. CentraCare is not concerned about doing the right thing and correcting a hostile environment within their organization as much as they are about projecting a positive image in the public.

job_title: CNA in Saint Cloud, MN
pros: It's a good company overall. Everyone is friendly throughout the company. Decent benefits, flexible scheduling. Overall organized and professional. Lots of volunteering opportunities as well.  Lots of focus on preventing burn-out. Free counseling programs. Lots of random, fun benefits like discounts at organizations in the area (Caribou Coffee, Clothes Mentor, certain apartment complexes, cell phone companies, auto repair)
cons: Low pay that could be rationalized with the benefit package if you're full time. If you decide to leave the company, you can't come back again. They won't even interview you. It's unfortunate because Centracare is so intertwined with the community.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Monticello, MN
pros: Good benefits; good hours; good pay
cons: poor communication between administration and staff; too "corporate" for a healthcare organization; poorly trained management

review_title: Great Opportunities with a great organization
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Cloud, MN
pros: CentraCare has countless opportunities to seek a great career in healthcare.
